nodes.name: get children folders from folder id
empty input ? (so no more id without children)

parameters.content: make a POST request with id in body

## How it works
a tree is instanciated with the id. A tree is a json object that looks like:

{
   id : "a google drive folder id",
   children: []
}

children having other nodes (if the id has subfolders) inside.

This workflow loops over this tree structure to progressively add children to each node until every node has a children key (that can have an empty array value after we verify it has no children).

## Note

This synchronization works only when there is a file mismatch between Notion and Google Drive.

If files are deleted or the content is updated in either end, they will not be synchronized on the other end.

## Important
Explicitly mention file extention both in Notion and Google Drive

main.node: empty input ? (so no more id without children)
get children folders from folder id
